snippet: As concerns over environmental effects and water usage have grown, about a dozen local governments have voted to restrict or prohibit fracking in their jurisdictions.
abstract: About a dozen local governments in California, responding to drought and powerful earthquakes, vote to restrict or prohibit fracking in their jurisdictions; concerns over environmental effects and water usage grow; bill to declare statewide moratorium on fracking is gathering support in State Senate.

byline.contributor: Ian Lovett contributed reporting from Los Angeles.

lead_paragraph: As concerns over environmental effects and water usage have grown, about a dozen local governments have voted to restrict or prohibit fracking in their jurisdictions.

headline.main: California’s Thirst Shapes Debate Over Fracking
headline.print_headline: California’s Thirst Shapes Debate Over Fracking
